<white>You gather the dry ink together in one hand, mixing them together into a morass of colour.
<white>Raising your hand to your mouth, you begin to gently blow the inks into the air.
<white>The ink momentarily swirls above your left leg and then begins to adhere.
<white>Concentrating, you force the ink to begin forming into the shape of a cloak.
<white>As the cloak tattoo's shape is codified, the last of the ink leaves the air, and you pause for a moment to admire your handiwork.
<white>The shrunken head in your inventory sneezes violently.
<#e5e5e5>You caress the tattoo and immediately you feel a cloak of protection surround you.
<white>Your mind is already touched by the Underking.

<#cdcd00><#00cdcd>A small opiate pill lies here. Reality bends inward here, forcing paths back upon themselves with prismatic inevitability. <#00ffff>Tredin is here, shrouded. He is riding on a lustrously-armored sprightly white mare. He wields an athame of astral fire in his left hand and a gladiator's trident in his right.<white>

<#e5e5e5>You bark at a bulky orgyuk and it rakes its claws through Tredin with its massive paws.
<#e5e5e5>You spit viciously onto your sitara before stabbing it directly into Tredin's shoulder.
<#e5e5e5>You discern that a layer of epteth has rubbed off your weapon.
<#e5e5e5>Tredin winces in pain, the wound reddening as it swells.
<white>You take a long drag off your pipe filled with reishi.
<white>Tredin presses a mending poultice against his left arm, rubbing the poultice into his flesh.
<white>You suddenly perceive the vague outline of an aura of rebounding around Tredin.
<#e5e5e5>Tredin tugs at the air around you, unspooling nothingness into inky black strands.
<#e5e5e5>Tredin unfurls a paper hypercube toward you. Impossible colors ripple across its surface, ensnaring your attention.
<#e5e5e5>Tredin unfurls a paper sphere. Colorful bursts of light lance from its core, assailing you with prismatic fury.
<#e5e5e5>The rainbow sphere curses you with clumsiness.
<white>Flying in chaotic circles, the moth finds a gap in your defence, darting in with unstoppable force to break your right arm.
<white>Thank the Gods! Your clumsiness has been cured.
<white>You press a mending poultice against your right arm, rubbing it into your flesh.
<white>The bones in your right arm mend.

<white>A verdant snaretongue strikes, serpentlike, for your throat.
<white>With the other paw, a bulky orgyuk rakes into Tredin with its wicked claws.
